author: zeeverse
title: A Crane on tracks? Oh yeah!
review:
My jaw almost hit the ground when I saw the Lego Technic 9391 Tracked Crane on the shelf in my local store. It's no secret that I love tracked vehicles, I love the Lego Technic Mini Construction Equipment kits, and I dig cranes. Needless to say, I happily picked this little gem off of the shelf and took it home to build.

The A model is awesome, and the build was very interesting. I always start with assembling the tracks first thing off the bat. I don't know why, but I just have to do it that way after building several Lego Technic tracked vehicles. And these small tracks are awesome. I've loved them ever since I built the Lego Technic 8259 Mini Bulldozer kit. And needless to say, I parked my freshly completed 9391 Tracked Crane right next to my 8259 Mini Bulldozer and they both look like they're ready to take on any construction site.

The B model for this kit is a surprise, and by surprise, I mean in a good sense. The B model is unusual in that I found that it is just as good a design as the A model, and that's always a nice bonus in a Lego Technic kit. The B model builds a medium sized bulldozer in Mini Scale and the B model looks right at home also next to my 8259 Mini Bulldozer. Of course, having already loved the A model, I was forced to go out and pick up another 9391 kit so I could enjoy both models at the same time.

In short, If a Lego Technic fan likes tracked vehicles, cranes, or bulldozers then I would think that the Lego Technic 9391 will find a lot of fans and could possibly be one of those kits that Lego Builders will have multiples of in their collections. In short, the 9391 is a great kit just on the single aspect of having what I think are awesome A and B models. I think it offers a lot of bang for the buck.

author: Legolijntje
title: One of the best small sets untill now
review:
I bought this set a few days ago for a very good price of €12,00. I bought it mainly for the new turnable and the tracks, but I like the model very much.

Box/Instructions

There's not much to say about the box and instructions of this model. It's a normal box with A model on the front and the B model on the back. This model has the "new" type of Technic instructions were the beams are less detailed. I don't like that very much.

Parts

This is a great small parts set:

  • The new mini turnable
  • The tracks
  • The telescopic boom
  • The new version of part 2905; part 99773
  • And 2 black versions of part 87082

The build

The build is not great, but good enough. Of course it's a small set, so, for it's size it's ok. Not much to tell here...

The completed model

The completed model is very good. It's functons are:

  • Turning the upperstructure
  • Lifting the boom up or down
  • Lower the rope with a hook
  • Extend the boom

There is one thing I think is a bit unnecessary: there is a gear to turn the upperstructure, but it's much easier to do it just with your hand. I know this is to let it have more funtions, but still it's a bit unnecessary.

 

Raising and lowering the boom goes very smoothly.

Summary

This is a very good set. Especially the parts. It has also a good playability, but it can be a bit unstable sometimes. I can really recommend this set.

…
